div.l: Bi goddes feith it schall noon oþir be
This Iohn aunswerd // aleyn auyse the
The Miller is a perilous man he seyde
And if þat he out of his slepe breyde
He myght doo vs bothe a velanye
Aleyn seid y cownte hym not a flie
Vp he arose and to þe wenche he crepte
Þis wenche lay vp right and fast slepte
Till he so nye was or sche myght espie
Þat it hadde be to late for to crye
And schortly for to sey // þei were at oon̄
Now pley on Aleyn // ⁊and y schal speke of Iohn
This Iohn lyeth stille a furlong wey or twoo
And to hym silf he makith rewthe and woo
Allas qduod he þis is a wickyd iape
Now may y say / y am but an ape
Ȝit hath my Felow somwhat for his harme
He hath þe Millers doughter in his arme
He auenturd hym and hath his nede spedde
And y lie as a draf sak still in my bedde
And when þis iape is tolde a nother day
I schal be holde a daftard a Cokenay
I wol arise ⁊and auntre me be my feith
Vnhardy vnesed þus men seyth
And vp he roos and softly went
Vnto þe Cradil ⁊and in his hande it hent
And bare it softly vnto his beddes feet
Sone aftir þis þe wife here rowtyng lete
And gan awake // and went here out to pisse
And came a gayn̄ and gan her cradil mysse
And groped here ⁊and þere ⁊and sche fonde noon
Allas qduod sche y hadde almost mysgoon̄
I had almost go to þe Clerkys bedde
Ey bn̄enedicitie þen had y foule spedde
And forth sche went til sche þe cradil fonde
And groped alwey further wᵗith here honde
And fonde þe bed and thowth noþing but good
By cause þat the Cradel be it stode
And wist not where sche was / for it was derk
And faire and well sche Crepte in bi þe Clerk
And lay full still and wolde haue cauth aslepe
Wᵗithin a while this Iohn þis Clerke vp lepe
And on þis good wife he leyde on sore
So mery a fitt had sche not long afore
He pryked harde ⁊and depe / as he were mad
This ioly lyfe haue þise Clerkes had
Þat til þe Cok thries began to syng
Aleyn wax wery in þe mornyng
For he had swonkyn al þe long nyght
And seide farewel Malkyn swete wight
The day is come y may no lenger abide
But euer more where so y go or ride
I am þin own Clerk so haue y hele
Now dere lemman qduod sche go fare wele
But or þou goo oo thyng woll y tell
Whan þat þou wendest homward by þe mell
